Begeisterung für komplexe Systeme sowie interdisziplinäre Aufgaben

Entwicklung und Pflege von Datenverarbeitungspipelines für die Echtzeitdatenanalyse von Messdaten

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist - Optimierungsmodelle (m/w/d)
Description:
Bei Laserhub haben wir Blech im Blut, mit unserer Beschaffungsplattform für den Teilekauf mischen wir die traditionelle Metallindustrie auf. Auf laserhub.com kommen Endkund:innen und Metallbearbeiter:innen über einen schlanken, digitalen Prozess zusammen. Statt sich wie bisher Tage oder Wochen mit einem Auftrag zu beschäftigen, verläuft dieser hier unschlagbar effizient – davon haben beide Seiten etwas. Mit viel Leidenschaft hat unser Team seit 2017 bewiesen, dass unser Prinzip am Markt ankommt – jetzt sind wir dabei, die gesamte metallverarbeitende Industrie digital und zukunftsfähig zu gestalten. Um unser großes Ziel zu erreichen, sind wir aktuell auf der Suche nach exzellenten Teammitgliedern für unser Engineering-Team als

(Senior) Data Scientist - Optimierungsmodelle (m/w/d)

In dieser Position bist du ein unverzichtbarer Teil des Produktteams und trägst wesentlich zum Erfolg des Produkts bei. Du kollaborierst mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams und arbeitest eng mit Produktmanagern, Ingenieuren und Metalltechnikexperten zusammen, um die besten Angebote für unsere Kunden zu erstellen und eine optimale Auftragsabwicklung zu ermöglichen. Du trägst dazu bei, unsere Daten zu verstehen, relevante Modelle zu erstellen und die Entscheidungsfindung bei Themen wie Angebotserstellung, Preisgestaltung, Auftragszuweisung, Zuverlässigkeit der Auftragsabwicklung usw. voranzutreiben. Du hilfst dabei, innovative und wertvolle Lösungen für die komplexen Anforderungen unserer B2B-Umgebung zu entwickeln.

Deine Mission:


Werde Experte in unserem Bereich - Gewinne ein tiefes Verständnis für unser Geschäft und unsere Prozesse, baue starke Beziehungen und Vertrauen zu den Stakeholdern auf und erkenne die größten Chancen

Weiterentwicklung: Du unterbreitest neue Ideen die Prozesse deiner Kunden zu optimieren und unsere Tools weiterzuentwickeln.

Dein Skillset:


Abschluss in Wirtschaftswissenschaften, (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, (Wirtschafts-) Ingenieurwesen, (Wirtschafts-) Mathematik oder vergleichbar
Idealerweise erste Erfahrungen und ein gutes Verständnis des Bankwesens in den Bereichen Aufsichtsrecht, Risikomanagement und Kreditprozesse
Gute Statistikkenntnisse, lineare/logistische Regression oder Machine-Learning-Modelle in der Risikoparameterschätzung (PD, LGD, CCF) zur Anwendung von Basel II bis IV oder IFRS 9
Ausgeprägte IT-Affinität und erste Kenntnisse in Skript- oder Programmiersprachen (z. B. Python, R, SAS) und relationalen Datenbanksystemen (SQL)
Hohes Engagement, Teamgeist, schnelle Auffassungsgabe und Freude an anspruchsvollen Projekten
Reisebereitschaft sowie Spaß an der Kommunikation und Präsentation für anspruchsvolle Zielgruppen auf Deutsch und Englisch (sehr gut in Wort und Schrift)


Deine Chance:


Spannende Aufgaben in einem innovativen Umfeld mit hochmotivierten Kolleg:innen, die sich schon jetzt auf deine Impulse freuen
Gute Rahmenbedingungen mit attraktivem Gehalt und zahlreichen Zusatzleistungen, z. B. Firmen-Smartphone, Fahrradleasing und Corporate Benefits
Work-Life-Balance durch Mobile Working & Teilzeit, EU Remote Working, Sabbaticals, Mitarbeiter:innen-Events, Well-being Angebote wie z. B. Gesundheitstage, Kooperationen mit Fitness-Anbietern und den Familienservice, der dich bei privaten Herausforderungen unterstützt
Exzellente Weiterbildung an der Deloitte University, in On- und Offline-Seminaren und im Rahmen der Berufsqualifikation, zum Beispiel Advanced Credit Risk Management (TU Delft)
Vielfältige Gestaltungsräume und aktive Förderung einer inklusiven Unternehmenskultur – u. a. durch unsere Diversity & Inclusion Mitarbeiter:innen-Netzwerke

Title: Internship in AI/ML Software Development for Sports Medicine – Start April 2025 (6 months)
Description:
We are excited to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces by Fortune Magazine!

The Stryker Sports Medicine team in Freiburg develops patient-specific solutions to support clinical decision-making for indications that can be treated with minimally invasive joint surgery.

As an intern in the team, you will contribute to the advancement of the Sports Medicine patient-specific solution offering. You will investigate and implement novel analysis methods, as well as evaluate the results.

Our offer to you


As a valued member of our international Sports Medicine R&D team you support the advancement of image-based enabling technologies.
Working with medical image data, you will extend your proficiency in AI/ML by applying computer vision and deep learning techniques to develop innovative solutions that can be used in pre-operative analysis and planning.
You will enhance your programming skills by developing software according to coding guidelines and under the guidance of experienced software developers.


This Is What Makes You Stand Out


Academic Pursuit: You are currently enrolled in a master’s program for computer science, software engineering or similar degree and are actively seeking an internship.
Technical Drive: You are passionate about improving your technical expertise, especially in areas like AI/ML and software development.
Software Savvy: Ideally, you are proficient in Python development and have initial experience with deep learning and frameworks such as Tensorflow or PyTorch and/or computer vision libraries (e.g. OpenCV), enabling you to work independently.
Effective Communication: Your strong spoken and written English skills empower you to confidently engage in our international environment and successfully document your work in scientific English.


Start Date: April 2025

Duration: 6 months

Location: Freiburg

We offer you: attractive remuneration, vacation entitlement, training and flexible working hours.

Diversity is important to us. We welcome applications from people regardless of their ethnic, national or social origin, gender, disability, age or sexual identity.

We look forward to receiving your online application with all relevant documents (letter of motivation, CV, examination regulations, current transcript of records, etc.). Please note that all the above attachments should be uploaded directly in one file under the "CV" section.

Stryker is a global leader in medical technologies and, together with its customers, is driven to make healthcare better. The company offers innovative products and services in MedSurg, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 150 million patients annually.

Title: Remote Platform Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Title
Remote Platform Engineer (m/f/d)

Job Description

Remote Platform Engineer
As a remote platform engineer you monitor, maintain, secure and operate the global platforms and their services/applications.

Your role:

You will be part of a newly built and growing team part of our Hospital Patient Monitoring Organization
You will be troubleshooting escalated incidents, resolving customer support cases and analysing and resolving work orders. The role involves improving triaging and troubleshooting capabilities, providing dashboards for support KPIs, and establishing proactive monitoring capabilities for both on-prem and cloud-based solutions.
You will be involved planning and executing updates to the platform, driving data-driven decisions, and exploring customer needs for a better customer experience.
You will be responsible for customer satisfaction and compliance requirements, and the use of LEAN techniques for operational efficiency improvements.
You will be involved in implementing triaging and routing processes, proactive monitoring, and developing dashboards for monitoring solutions.
Communication and building working relationships with different teams and support levels is crucial
You will benefit from a hybrid working model (this means working in-person at least 3 days per week)
From a competitive salary to flexible working, a career at Philips comes with all sorts of wonderful benefits. Be sure to speak to your recruiter about benefits in your region.


You're the right fit if:

You hold a bachelor’s degree in engineering (or comparable degree).
You have 3+ years’ of relevant work experience.
You have experience in Helpdesk or Service Centers environments
You have experience working and operating in complex multi-national and remote environments with highly distributed teams.
You are fluent in English (verbal and written).
Familiar with DevOps ways of working in collaboration with 3rd level support and DevOps teams.
You have experience in the healthcare domain (desirable).
You have a working knowledge of and experience with Linux, Kubernetes, GitHub, Observability tools like Grafana, public clouds, Distributed Systems, and Microservices (desirable).
You have experience in swarming-based incident resolution models (desirable).
You have experience in Customer Service Management including management of digital channels and self-service solutions (desirable).
You hold a certification in a public cloud provider such as Linux System Administration, ITIL, etc. (desirable).


How We Work Together

We believe that we are better together than apart. For our office-based teams, this means working in-person at least 3 days per week. Onsite roles require full-time presence in the company’s facilities. Field roles are most effectively done outside of the company’s main facilities, generally at the customers’ or suppliers’ locations.

This role is an office role.

About Philips

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help improve the lives of others.


Learn more about our business.
Discover our rich and exciting history.
Learn more about our purpose.


If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.

Equal Opportunities Disclaimer
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

For more information, read our Inclusion and Diversity Policy and, to know more about your Human Rights, we encourage you to view this report.

For candidates with disabilities, we’re committed to supplying reasonable accommodations during the recruitment process, as well as when you enter our employment. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please make your recruiter aware.

Description:
YOUR BRILLIANT FUTURE IN TECH IS NOW

Welcome to the world of Zoi. We are those who build the digital evolution of our enterprise customers, closing the gap between enterprise IT and new technologies. Zoi strives to bring the cloud to the Retail and Manufacturing industries with innovative solutions that deliver real value.




We are expanding our development team in Stuttgart. Travel between our locations is possible.







WHAT YOU DO

You are responsible for the implementation and further development of apps based on ReactNative.
As part of our agile app developer team, you develop solutions for our IoT topics and combine app and cloud connections to create a complete product
You will work hand in hand with the creative team from UX and the backend developers of the cloud platform.
Your solution concepts are based on the ReactNative stack, integrate the latest development trends and thus flow into the basic set of future app developments.
Together with our test team, you define and optimise the necessary test processes for quality assurance of the app across functional, integration and UX.




WHO YOU ARE

You have a passion for app development and a degree in computer science or a comparable field.
Several years of work experience of at least 2 years as an app developer or web developer makes you saddle-fast and curious
You have in-depth knowledge of ReactJs or ReactNative and IoT connectivity modules such as BLE and WiFi.
Demonstrated experience in IoT product development
Native development experience with Android or iOS is a plus.
You have basic knowledge of modern web technologies such as Javascript, HTML and CSS.
Knowledge of NodeJs and Serverless is an advantage in order to better understand the overall context.
You approach problems responsibly, solution-oriented and as a fair team player.
You quickly find your way around in project teams and appreciate interdisciplinary work.







Do you like to be surrounded by brilliant minds? Awesome. At Zoi, you become part of our community of tech enthusiasts and develop your full potential. Create fresh ideas and shape the digital transformation of our enterprise customers sustainably.




GOOD WORK SHOULD BE REWARDED - which is why we offer various bonus models at our company
TIME IS WISDOM - 20 % of your working time is available for experimenting and education
SKILL YOURSELF UP - Zoi can only be as good as you are. That’s why we value constant training and development
BE FREE - thanks to our absolutely flexible working hours and work remotely from any of our locations
DEVELOP YOURSELF - with our individual certification and training plan
FAMILY COMES FIRST - rely on our financial support for childcare
REFUEL - at our regular free Friday lunch

Description:
AudaCity Capital is a progressive and flourishing prop trading firm, and trading education provider. We are based in London, and at the moment have a team of highly trained properly trading professionals, managing the company’s extensive funds on our City of London based trading floor.We believe that the only way to be a winner in our industry is to invest heavily in talented people who want to grow with us. We are seeking like-minded professionals to develop their skills and enable them to join our team.We trade on all major asset classes on multiple exchanges with our own capital and do not handle any client funds or have customers. By becoming a member of the team, you become part of our success. Developing scripts to process structured and unstructured data.

Ideal Profile


You possess a degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering or related field.

Demonstrated experience working with large and complex data sets as well as experience analyzing volumes of data.

You have working knowledge of Artificial intelligence
You are highly goal driven and work well in fast paced environments
You possess strong analytical skills and are comfortable dealing with numerical data
You enjoy finding creative solutions to problems


What's on Offer?


Work within a company with a solid track record of success
Leadership Role
Flexible working options

Title: Data Science Graduate
Description:
Data Science Graduate: Kick-start your life-changing career!
Are you a master’s student with an interest in data science? Be a part of Novo Nordisk’s growth journey and accelerate your own. Turn your degree into a global career at one of the world's leading pharmaceutical companies!

About The Data Science Graduate Programme

The full-time position as a Data Science Graduate offers three exciting eight-month rotations across our company and value chain, providing you with a broad experience and skills within data science and data engineering. You get to experience first-hand how data science plays a role across the business in ensuring that Novo Nordisk can better develop and deliver life-changing medicines to our patients.

During the programme you will work in different teams in Research & Early Development, Development, areas of Digital Data, Data Science and IT, and Product Supply utilizing different technologies within statistics, modelling, AI, or vision technologies. You will be working in a global organisation with many different stakeholders in an international network of world-class colleagues, where your contributions and perspectives will play a valuable role in shaping the future of Data Science at Novo Nordisk within the

pharmaceutical industry.

As you embark on your life-changing career in Novo Nordisk, we will provide you with:



Accelerated personal and professional development from day one
International professional experience
Vast exposure and networking possibilities




The Position
Over the course of this two-year programme, you will expand your international network, while experiencing how digital transformations in pharma take place alongside our skilled colleagues across the organisation. Together we will shape your journey by choosing the focus during your three rotations, all while being mentored by experienced colleagues who will challenge and guide your development.

You will take part in different use cases, covering front-end, back-end, development, and applications of advanced analytics. As a unique feature, you will have the possibility to investigate different elements in the pharmaceutical value chain, learning to apply your skills in different settings, ranging from development of new medicines, to delivering high quality medicines from complex production units.

Qualifications

To thrive and succeed as a Data Science Graduate, we expect you to have: 



Recent master’s degree (from 2024 or 2025) in either Data Science, Data Science Engineering, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Systems Biology, Pharmacometrics, Mathematics/Statistic/Physics, or similar within Life Science or Manufacturing/Supply Chain combined with strong programming skills
Above average academic achievements
International experience, for example from studying a full semester abroad, working or volunteering
No more than 1 year of full-time work experience between or after completing a master’s degree
Fluency in spoken and written English
Globally mobile (also beyond the Graduate Programme)




If you meet the criteria and are interested in joining the programme with start-up date 1 September 2025, please make sure to submit your application no later than 30 November 2024 GMT+1.
Important: upload this when you apply
Before clicking the apply button, please ensure you have uploaded your CV (please upload under “resume”), cover letter and most recent academic records (upload these two documents as one file under “cover letter”) in English. Applications without these uploads will not be considered.

In the cover letter we expect to learn more about your motivation for wanting to join Novo Nordisk and the Graduate Programme, as well as your personal and professional competencies. Hence, make sure you include:



What are your expectations from the graduate programme, and how will it support your career aspirations?
What team characteristics do you value, and what three qualities do you believe others appreciate about you?
Define innovation in the context of data science, in your opinion
Share a specific example of solving a challenging data science-related task in previous work or projects. Provide details about the problem and your solution




The cover letter must not exceed one page.

You can apply from any device but as you will be asked to answer several questions on the application page, we recommend applying from a PC instead of a mobile phone.

About The Graduate Programme

Our Global Graduate Programme is designed to bring together change makers with a diversity of perspectives and equip them with the tools needed to accelerate their personal and professional development. The two-year programme allows you to explore the world while developing your career. You will be taken on three rotations around the globe where you will work in a fast-paced environment and grow in ways you never could have imagined. You will be exposed to the entire Novo Nordisk value chain while being challenged to explore your boundaries and reach your full potential.

If you want a general introduction to the Novo Nordisk Graduate Programme including all 18 tracks then click here.

Contact
For questions about the Data Science Graduate Programme please contact one of our current graduates Anna Maria Lewicka oalw@novonordisk.com or Carolina Santos Carvalho Caramelo csoz@novonordisk.com. You can also click on this link for information on our upcoming graduate webinars.

About Novo Nordisk

Novo Nordisk is a global healthcare company, founded in 1923 and headquartered just outside Copenhagen, Denmark. Our purpose is to drive change to defeat serious chronic diseases, built upon our heritage in diabetes. We do so by pioneering scientific breakthroughs, expanding access to our medicines, and working to prevent and ultimately cure the diseases we treat. We employ more than 69,000 people in 80 offices around the world, and market our products in 170 countries. We are on a relentless mission to drive change for millions of people living with chronic diseases, and we need people like you to join us on this mission and take Novo Nordisk into the future.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Title: R&D Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Nordetect is on a mission to improve how chemicals are used in the food chain. We are a DeepTech company that produces Lab-on-a-chip devices and data analysis software for environmental and agricultural testing. Our products enable farm managers, greenhouse growers, and vertical farmers to reduce risk and ensure richer harvests by leveraging data that is easy to understand and implement.

We're in the process of growing our customer base and are looking for new members to join us on this mission.




In your role as an R&D scientist, you will mainly focus on the formulation of sensors, data analysis and statistical modeling, along with benchmarking and validation experiments. You will work in a multi-disciplinary team with colleagues with Machine Learning, Nanotechnology, and Hardware development backgrounds.




Responsibilities:

Taking the lead on all activities involving chemistry and chemical analysis
Improving the robustness of our dataset collection process by implementing SOPs
Visualizing and filtering data, statistical analysis, and developing data model relationships
Research and development within sensor formulation and functionalizing membranes
Troubleshooting issues with analytical product performance
Collaborating with our software engineering department, production engineers, and product designers
Maintaining an overview of the laboratories, and chemical inventory management




Qualifications:

Proven work experience (3+ years) in assay development, analytical chemistry, or similar laboratory roles
A Master's degree in chemistry, pharmacy, biochemistry, or related engineering fields
Strong laboratory skills, including method development, troubleshooting, sample preparation, and statistical analysis
An understanding of formulation and fabrication of chemosensors
Experience with spectrophotometric analysis techniques is necessary
Good problem-solving and quantitative skills
Excellent communication skills in English




As a person, you are energetic and take initiative to get things done. Your work is structured and you are able to manage priorities and maintain timelines. You work well independently but see yourself as a team player with the motivation to work within a fast-paced, interdisciplinary, and dynamic environment. Furthermore, you are legally allowed to reside and work in Denmark and do not need to relocate for this position.




If this looks like a job you would thrive in, we'd like to hear from you. We conduct interviews on a rolling basis and are looking to close the position as soon as possible.

Please apply online by submitting your CV and relevant cover letter (merged into one file) through this job posting.

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Stillingsbeskrivelse

Vil du være med til at udvikle nogle af branchens vigtigste og mest komplekse IT-løsninger? Som Software Developer i Netcompany vil du være med til at gøre en mærkbar forskel for både vores offentlige og private kunder.

Arbejdsopgaver og teknologi

Som Software Developer vil du blive en del af vores Netcompany Application Services, der består af en fast teamstruktur, der driver porteføljer af spændende kunder og projekter. Din hverdag vil være præget af både tekniske og kunderettede opgaver med leverancer, der spænder fra nyudvikling af IT-projekter til løbende udvikling på eksisterende løsninger og serviceydelser.

I Netcompany leverer vi på alle markedsudbredte teknologier herunder .Net, C#, Java, Salesforce, Sharepoint, Dynamics CRM, Business Central ERP, Sitecore, ReactJS, Angular, Docker, Azure, Azure DevOps, Octopus, Oracle, Episerver m.fl. Valget af teknologi bestemmes altid efter, hvad der giver kunden størst værdi. Det er derfor vigtigt, at du synes, det er sjovt at arbejde med nye og varierende områder og teknologier samt finder det motiverende at udbygge din viden kontinuerligt.

Dine arbejdsopgaver kan bl.a. indebære:


Kundedialog og behovsafklaring
Implementering af funktioner i brugergrænsefladen
Programmering af frontend og backend til nye features i kundens løsninger
Opsætning og udvikling af frameworks samt integrationer
Konfiguration og udvikling af extensions til standardplatforme
Automatisering af forretningsprocesser i form af f.eks. batchjobs


Om dig

Vi forestiller os, at du er universitetsuddannet bachelor eller diplomingeniør inden for eksempelvis datalogi, software, IT eller lignende. Derudover forestiller vi os, at du:


Er nyuddannet eller har et par års erfaring - vigtigst er, at du brænder for at tage din karriere inden for IT til næste niveau
Besidder gode IT-tekniske kompetencer inden for objektorienteret programmering
Har et analytisk og problemløsende mindset, der gør dig i stand til at løse komplekse og tekniske opgaver for vores kunder


Fortsæt din udvikling hos os

I Netcompany har vi fokus på din personlige og faglige udvikling.

Når du starter hos os, får du en personlig mentor, som vil vejlede dig igennem din udvikling og i at nå dine mål. Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

We are a forward-thinking tech company committed to leveraging open-source technologies to drive innovation. Our team is passionate about building scalable solutions and fostering a collaborative environment. We are looking for a talented Senior Backend Developer with a strong focus on Python coding skills and interest in MLOps / DevOps to join our dynamic team.

The project will focus on building AI tools from scratch, selecting the right technologies and tools to build something flexible, scalable and powerful. The profile will be interacting with the ML team and the Research team to improve and expand the framework capabilities along the way.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain robust backend systems using Python, adhering to best coding practices.
Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipelines to ensure smooth deployment processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate DevOps practices, with a focus/interest on MLOps.
Clear communication
Evaluate open-source projects and encourage the use of the latest tools within the team.
Utilize your knowledge of SQL and database management to optimize data storage and retrieval.
Work with cloud platforms to deploy and manage applications, ensuring high availability and scalability.
Create and maintain unit and functional tests.
Document code effectively to ensure clarity and maintainability for future development.
Implement and advocate for best practices in a Git environment.


Qualifications


Proven experience in backend development with a strong emphasis on Python.
Passionate about coding, applying best practices and libraries.
Solid understanding of DevOps principles and experience in building CI/CD pipelines.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
Understanding of SQL and database management systems.
Experience with Docker and containerization technologies.
Software architecture for large scale systems.
Knowledge of microservices architecture and its implementation.
Passion for open-source software and active participation in the community.
Strong computer science fundamentals involving object-oriented design, data structures, and complexity analysis.
Ability to produce high-quality code documentation.


Nice To Have


Interest or background in machine learning.
Enthusiasm and contributions to the open-source community.
Basic knowledge of the C/C++ is not required, but nice to have.


What We Offer


Competitive salaries
Supplemental pension contributions (depending on location)
30 days of annual vacation
Flexible work hours, remote when you need to
Remote work supported (if the timezone is plus/minus 1/2hrs from Copenhagen)
Flat hierarchy
Great focus on work/life balance
Bleeding edge tech stack
Skilled co-workers that are driven by a passion to create


Diversity & Culture

We strongly believe in a discrimination-free workplace. Harassment, bullying and exclusionary practices are not tolerated. We embrace diversity of experience, perspectives, and background: they help us create a people-positive work environment and engaging games. Whoever you are, your application receives fair consideration

Title: Research Scientist, Protein Chemistry & Assays, Novonesis
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Research Scientist

We can offer a 12-month temporary position where we are looking for a research scientist with a deep passion in understanding complex substrate/enzyme interactions and linking knowledge to real application systems like food, feed, bioenergy & detergent. The position will be in R&D, Protein Chemistry & Assay, in the Department of Enzymology, Substrates & Assays.

Welcome to Protein Chemistry & Assays

The function of Protein, Chemistry & Assay is very international, and we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team, so you can expect to work alongside colleagues of different nationalities, cultures, and expertise. We emphasize the importance of well-being, including creating a good and well-functioning working environment, supporting our employees' work-life balance, and offering flexible working arrangements.

The Department Enzymology, Substrates and Assays consists of 24 scientists and technicians located in Novonesis' Innovation Campus in Lyngby.

The department has a strong focus on enzymology, biochemistry and biophysics and builds on values characterized by passion, experience, professionalism, and a good work culture. We contribute to new product development by generating and sharing innovative ideas, building application relevant screening assays, understanding complex substrate/enzymes interactions and through in-depth knowledge help guide enzyme candidate selection in projects. By covering a wide range of industries, this position enables you to contribute to the development of sustainable products for diverse applications such as food, dairy, baking, human health, bioenergy, and household care.

In This Role You’ll Make An Impact By

Working on parallel research projects by being part of a project team with chemists and laboratory technicians across departments and countries. It is expected that you thrive on managing several tasks at the same time. An important role is also to explore and develop new technologies in-house or via external collaboration where your collaborative mindset and learning capability is crucial.

The successful candidate is a strong team player who can independently plan and execute analyses in the laboratory.

To Succeed You Must Have


A PhD in biochemistry, biophysics or biotechnology or a Master’s degree with equivalent work experience
Strong scientific background with critical thinking skills, entrepreneurship mindset and ability to formulate ideas for experiments from diverse data/knowledge inputs and application/business relevant project needs.
Solid knowledge of protein chemistry
Strong communication skills, an open-minded and positive attitude, and a desire to achieve results together with others.


Additional we expect you to be fluent in English as you will work closely with colleagues of many different nationalities.

It Is An Advantage If You Have


Deep knowledge and working experience with proteins or other biologicals.
Experience with enzyme kinetics and characterization, assay automation, robotic liquid handling workstations.
An interest in programming, (Python, JMP scripting), and working with large databases.


Are you our next colleague in our team? Become a part of Novonesis and unfold your potential with us.

Place

Workplace Novonesis Innovation Campus in Lyngby, Denmark. Biologiens Vej 2, 2800 Kongens Lyngby, Greater Copenhagen - Danmark.

Do you have a passion for sustainable solutions, and can you see yourself in this position? So, follow your passion and apply today!

Application deadline: 30 November 2024.

Contact information: For more information, please contact Senior Department Manager Søren Flensted Lassen (sfl@novonesis.com).

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Title: Forretningsorienteret Data Scientist
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Video Plugin

Forretningsorienteret Data Scientist

Vi søger en Senior Data Scientist, der udover stærke modellerings-, data- og softwarekompetencer også har lyst til et tæt samarbejde med forretningen omkring implementering og anvendelse af vores modeller for bl.a. at optimere salg og styrke fastholdelsen af vores kunder.

Om os | Et stærkt analysemiljø

Du bliver en del af et mindre AI- & Data Science team, som er placeret tæt på forretningen i Technical Excellence i Privat DK divisionen. Foruden AI & Data Science afdelingen, består Technical Excellence af vores Portfolio Management- og Pricing teams, hvor vi har mange års erfaring med at arbejde med data og modeller i en forretningskontekst. Derudover bliver du en del af et stærkt fagligt netværk på tværs af Trygs forretningsområder.

Om rollen | Understøt kunderejsen i Tryg

Som vores nye Data Scientist kommer du til at udvikle full-stack løsninger, der ofte baserer sig på moderne anvendt statistik og Machine Learning-algoritmer. Du vil få berøring med flere dele af værdikæden, herunder at identificere behov, etablering af datagrundlag, modellering, implementering, monitorering og effektmåling.

Mere konkret får du opgaver relateret til churn-modellering, lead-generering, produktanbefaling, optimering af salg f.eks. ”Next Best Offer”, A/B-testing, og vigtigst af alt også muligheden for at præge dine arbejdsopgaver i en retning, hvor de skaber størst forretningsværdi og dine kompetencer udnyttes på bedste vis.

Vores tech-stack indeholder bl.a. virtuelle maskiner i Azure, Kafka, Mongo- og SQL-databaser, Docker, Kubernetes, og en Python-baseret kodebase i Gitlab. Dertil distribueres output fra vores løsninger typisk til produktionssystemer via web services. Vores analytiske platform er under løbende udvikling, så du vil også skulle håndtere udfordringer indenfor data, værktøjer og infrastruktur, men vi er godt på vej i den rigtige retning.

Vi mener, at de bedste løsninger opstår i tæt samarbejde med forretningen. En vigtig del af jobbet er derfor at kommunikere direkte med stakeholders i forretningen for at forstå deres processer og udfordringer, så du kan hjælpe med at yde effektiv beslutningsstøtte og understøtte den gode kundeoplevelse.

Om dig | Kompetent, erfaren og forretningsorienteret Data Scientist

Vi søger en passioneret, selvstændig og ambitiøs Data Scientist, der har erfaring med at bygge machine learning-applikationer i en forretningskontekst. Du trives med forretningsdialog, og besidder gode kommunikationskompetencer, så du kan formidle dine idéer og være med til at sikre en god forståelse mellem analyse og forretning. Endvidere har du en interesse i Trygs forretning, systemer og processer, da det kræver et godt domænekendskab, for at kunne levere værdiskabende modeller og løsninger.

Vi forventer, at du har:


Stærke data- og modelleringskompetencer kombineret med et godt forretningsmindset.
Bred viden indenfor statistiske metoder, herunder Machine Learning-modeller, fx neurale netværk (gerne RNN), boosting metoder, A/B-testing og overlevelsesanalyse.
Praktisk erfaring med at implementere data pipelines og Machine Learning-modeller i produktion.
En stærk og relevant uddannelsesbaggrund i Machine Learning, Statistik, Matematik, Økonomi, Computer Science eller lignende.


Derudover er det en fordel, hvis du har:


Erfaring med følgende sprog, pakker og værktøjer, som vi anvender: Python, SQL, NO-SQL, Gitlab, Kafka, MongoDB, Kubernetes, Docker, Azure, Linux, Cloud Computing, Webservices, Jupyterlab, PyTorch, Tensorflow og Sklearn.
Interesse i GDPR, AI act, dataetik m.v. således at du kan sikre en stærk compliance i dit arbejde


Nysgerrig?

Send din ansøgning allerede i dag og senest 1. december 2024. Når den rette kandidat er fundet afsluttes rekrutteringsprocessen. Hvis du har spørgsmål er du velkommen til at kontakte leder af AI & Data Science i Privat DK, Anders Christian Jensen på anders.jensen@tryg.dk eller +45 25100366

Custom Plugin

Diversitet & inklusion skaber et stærkere Tryg

Vi mener, at mangfoldighed i tankegang er afgørende for vores fremtidige succes, og vi ønsker at afspejle det samfund, vi er en del af. Derfor arbejder vi målrettet på at sikre en mangfoldig og inkluderende arbejdsplads, hvor du føler dig respekteret, kan være dig selv og har lige muligheder for at udvikle dig og gøre karriere.

Forretningsorienteret Data Scientist

Vi søger en Senior Data Scientist, der udover stærke modellerings-, data- og softwarekompetencer også har lyst til et tæt samarbejde med forretningen omkring implementering og anvendelse af vores modeller for bl.a. at optimere salg og styrke fastholdelsen af vores kunder.

Om os | Et stærkt analysemiljø

Du bliver en del af et mindre AI- & Data Science team, som er placeret tæt på forretningen i Technical Excellence i Privat DK divisionen. Foruden AI & Data Science afdelingen, består Technical Excellence af vores Portfolio Management- og Pricing teams, hvor vi har mange års erfaring med at arbejde med data og modeller i en forretningskontekst. Derudover bliver du en del af et stærkt fagligt netværk på tværs af Trygs forretningsområder.

Om rollen | Understøt kunderejsen i Tryg

Som vores nye Data Scientist kommer du til at udvikle full-stack løsninger, der ofte baserer sig på moderne anvendt statistik og Machine Learning-algoritmer. Du vil få berøring med flere dele af værdikæden, herunder at identificere behov, etablering af datagrundlag, modellering, implementering, monitorering og effektmåling.

Mere konkret får du opgaver relateret til churn-modellering, lead-generering, produktanbefaling, optimering af salg f.eks. ”Next Best Offer”, A/B-testing, og vigtigst af alt også muligheden for at præge dine arbejdsopgaver i en retning, hvor de skaber størst forretningsværdi og dine kompetencer udnyttes på bedste vis.

Vores tech-stack indeholder bl.a. virtuelle maskiner i Azure, Kafka, Mongo- og SQL-databaser, Docker, Kubernetes, og en Python-baseret kodebase i Gitlab. Dertil distribueres output fra vores løsninger typisk til produktionssystemer via web services. Vores analytiske platform er under løbende udvikling, så du vil også skulle håndtere udfordringer indenfor data, værktøjer og infrastruktur, men vi er godt på vej i den rigtige retning.

Vi mener, at de bedste løsninger opstår i tæt samarbejde med forretningen. En vigtig del af jobbet er derfor at kommunikere direkte med stakeholders i forretningen for at forstå deres processer og udfordringer, så du kan hjælpe med at yde effektiv beslutningsstøtte og understøtte den gode kundeoplevelse.

Om dig | Kompetent, erfaren og forretningsorienteret Data Scientist

Vi søger en passioneret, selvstændig og ambitiøs Data Scientist, der har erfaring med at bygge machine learning-applikationer i en forretningskontekst. Du trives med forretningsdialog, og besidder gode kommunikationskompetencer, så du kan formidle dine idéer og være med til at sikre en god forståelse mellem analyse og forretning. Endvidere har du en interesse i Trygs forretning, systemer og processer, da det kræver et godt domænekendskab, for at kunne levere værdiskabende modeller og løsninger.

Vi forventer, at du har:

  • Stærke data- og modelleringskompetencer kombineret med et godt forretningsmindset.
  • Bred viden indenfor statistiske metoder, herunder Machine Learning-modeller, fx neurale netværk (gerne RNN), boosting metoder, A/B-testing og overlevelsesanalyse.
  • Praktisk erfaring med at implementere data pipelines og Machine Learning-modeller i produktion.
  • En stærk og relevant uddannelsesbaggrund i Machine Learning, Statistik, Matematik, Økonomi, Computer Science eller lignende.

Derudover er det en fordel, hvis du har:

  • Erfaring med følgende sprog, pakker og værktøjer, som vi anvender: Python, SQL, NO-SQL, Gitlab, Kafka, MongoDB, Kubernetes, Docker, Azure, Linux, Cloud Computing, Webservices, Jupyterlab, PyTorch, Tensorflow og Sklearn.
  • Interesse i GDPR, AI act, dataetik m.v. således at du kan sikre en stærk compliance i dit arbejde

Title: Senior manager, Data scientist in Corporate Finance
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

This role is a strong opportunity to elevate digitalization in financial planning in the LEGO Group and to gain E2E knowledge on the LEGO Group's financial processes and grow a strong network across the organization!

As part of the Corporate reporting and planning team, you will play a key role in using data and drive innovation and continuous improvement in the financial planning processes and build on your already excellent finance data scientist career!

No relocation assistance is offered for this position


Core Responsibilities





Drive the aspiration on business analysis and push the data focus in defining the new financial planning processes
Leverage data driven forecasting in financial planning e.g. via driver-based planning, predictive planning and sensible machine learning to drive automation and reduced cycle time with less effort
Engage with partners across Finance to drive the implementation and support the change journey
Be one of the subject matter experts training and supporting colleagues building confidence in the data driven approach
Co-drive validation and recommendation on the model selection in a new forecast engine in collaboration with the technical developers
Prepare the reporting supporting transparency in the models and building a storyline on the development




Play your part in our team succeeding

Do you have what it takes?

We expect our preferred candidate to hold a Master's degree in Data science/Data engineering/ Economics / Finance or similar





5-8 years of experience with data science or data engineering, preferably with a focus on finance
Strong analytical skills and experience with predictive planning/ machine learning /Python/R or similar
Superb communication and collaboration skills
Location in Billund or Copenhagen office




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Python Developer
Place: Vejle Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our customer has an exciting role to add a software engineer to the AI and Data team,




They’re looking for a solution-driven developer with a strong Python background and a collaborative mindset to help transform the vehicle trading industry. You’ll have the opportunity to make a real difference by simplifying the buying and selling process for their clients.

At this company, they approach every challenge as an adventure! Their teams are organized into specialized problem spaces, each focusing on real-world industry challenges.




As part of the team, you’ll contribute to their mission of enhancing automotive trading by developing solutions that make a genuine impact.




Your Role and Impact:

As a key member of their tech and product team, you’ll design and implement scalable software solutions that strengthen their position in the european market. You’ll transform complex requirements into seamless, user-friendly functionalities.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and develop software solutions in Python, ensuring efficiency, security, and scalability
Take ownership of your code from development to deployment, with a focus on quality and sustainability
Troubleshoot and resolve issues to optimize system performance and user experience
Work closely with an international team in an agile environment, promoting a culture of continuous improvement
Stay engaged in learning new technologies and seeking opportunities for professional growth

Must-Have Skills:

Bachelor's or master’s degree in computer science or a related field
Solid Python experience and a strong foundation in object-oriented programming
Proficiency with both relational and document-based databases
Familiarity with design patterns, architectural principles, and development best practices
Effective problem-solving abilities with a knack for debugging and code optimization
Strong English communication skills (fluency in Danish is a plus)




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Agile/SCRUM experience
Knowledge of Git, GitHub Actions, and AWS infrastructure
Experience with RESTful API integration




Your Colleagues Describe You As:

A dependable and dedicated team contributor
Positive, engaging, and a pleasure to work with
Reliable in delivering high-quality work on time
A true team player with a strong drive




Please reach out to me on LinkedIn or drop me an email at c.thomas@jeffersonfrank.com

Excel in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI, with a knack for advancing technology.

Embrace the challenge of merging diverse data for revolutionary models.

Receive a potential offer.
